title: 109_s3623
content: The Act may be cited as the "Coal-to-Liquid Fuel Promotion Energy Act of 2006". Definitions are provided in the Act. The Act, known as the "Coal-to-Liquid Fuel Promotion Energy Act of 2006," defines key terms such as "coal-to-liquid" and "Secretary." The term "coal-to-liquid" refers to the use of coal resources in the United States to produce synthetic fuel suitable for transportation using the Fischer-Tropsch process. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Energy. The Coal-to-Liquid Fuel Promotion Energy Act of 2006 defines "coal-to-liquid" as using coal resources in the US to produce synthetic fuel for transportation. The Act also defines the term "Secretary" as the Secretary of Energy. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include large-scale coal-to-liquid facilities that produce at least 10,000 barrels a day of liquid transportation fuel using US coal resources. Appropriations are authorized for guarantees for these projects under section 1703(b)(11). The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to include large-scale coal-to-liquid facilities that produce at least 10,000 barrels a day of liquid transportation fuel using US coal resources. Loan guarantees for projects are limited to no more than 20,000 barrels of coal-to-liquid fuel per day or until the production capacity reaches 100,000 barrels per day. Large-scale coal-to-liquid facilities producing over 20,000 barrels per day must provide non-Federal funding for loan guarantees exceeding that amount. SEC. 4. COAL-TO-LIQUID FACILITIES LOAN PROGRAM. The Secretary will establish a program providing loans up to $20,000,000 for eligible recipients owning coal-to-liquid facilities producing at least 10,000 barrels per day. Applicants must submit an application meeting specified requirements to receive the loan. To be eligible for a loan under this section, recipients must provide a dollar-for-dollar match with non-Federal funds. Repayment of the loan must be made within 5 years, and can come from any financing received for the coal-to-liquid facility. $200,000,000 is authorized for this section. $200,000,000 is appropriated for this section, to remain available until expended. SEC. 5. The Secretary will create regulations to support coal-to-liquid manufacturing facilities on Federal land, including carbon dioxide capture. SEC. 6. Addresses the Strategic Petroleum Reserve. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to include a study on maintaining coal-to-liquid products in the Reserve, to be conducted by the Secretary and the Secretary of Defense. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to allow the Secretary to construct storage facilities for coal-to-liquid products near pipeline infrastructure and military bases, outside state boundaries on the Gulf of Mexico coast. Additionally, amendments are made to include petroleum products in the Reserve. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to include coal-to-liquid products in the Reserve, with a limit of 20 percent of total petroleum products. Subsections and paragraphs are redesignated for clarity. The Energy Policy and Conservation Act is amended to include coal-to-liquid products in the Reserve, with a limit of 20 percent of total petroleum products. Amendments include redesignating subsections and paragraphs for clarity. SEC. 7 authorizes $10,000,000 for the Air Force Research Laboratory to continue testing and procuring synthetic fuels from coal for aviation use. SEC. 8 addresses coal-to-liquid facilities near military installations. Section 2398a of title 10, United States Code is amended to allow the Secretary of Defense to enter into contracts with private companies to develop coal-to-liquid facilities near military installations. Considerations include land availability and testing. The Secretary of Defense can enter contracts with private companies to develop coal-to-liquid facilities near military installations. Considerations include land availability, testing opportunities, and proximity to raw materials. Authorization of appropriations is provided for necessary funding.
